lines.content: * Represents the main application for managing tasks as Minnim chatbot.
* The Minnim class is responsible for initializing the task list, UI, and storage,
* and for handling the main application loop that processes user commands.
* Initializes the Minnim application with the specified file path for storing tasks.
* This constructor sets up the user interface, loads tasks from storage, and sets up
* the parser to interpret user commands.
* @param filePath the file path where task data is stored
ui.showMessage("Below is the current task list:");
* Runs the Minnim application, processing user input and executing commands.
* The method continuously accepts user input from the console, passes the input to the parser,
* and executes corresponding actions until the program is terminated.
* @throws MinnimMissingTaskDetailException if a task detail is missing during command parsing
* @throws MinnimMissingDateException if a date is missing during command parsing
* @throws MinnimTargetTaskNumNotFoundException if the task number is not found during marking or deleting
* @throws MinnimNoTaskFoundException if no task is found with the specified task number
public void run() throws MinnimMissingTaskDetailException, MinnimMissingDateException,
public static void main(String[] args) throws MinnimMissingTaskDetailException, MinnimMissingDateException,
* Represents a base exception for the Minnim application.
* This is an abstract class that extends Exception
* and serves as a parent for specific custom exceptions.
public abstract class MinnimException extends Exception{
* Returns a string representation of the exception.
* This method is overridden to provide a custom message.
* @return A sad face ":(" representing an error state.
* Exception thrown when a deadline or event task is missing a required date.
* Returns a string representation of the exception.
* Provides a user-friendly error message indicating a missing date.
* @return A formatted error message specifying the missing date requirement.
return String.format("You are missing date for deadline/event task. Please provide as necessary. %s",
* Returns a string representation of the exception.
* Provides a user-friendly error message indicating a missing task detail.
* @return A formatted error message specifying the missing task detail requirement.
return String.format("You are missing your task name. Please Provide one! %s", super.toString());
return String.format("I cannot find the task number %d. %s", this.taskNum, super.toString());
return String.format("You are missing your target task number. Please Provide one! %s", super.toString());

* @throws MinnimNoTaskFoundException          If the specified task number does not exist.
* Handles loading and saving tasks to a file.
* Constructs a Storage object with the specified file path and UI handler.

* Loads tasks from the specified file.

ui.showMessage("Task file not found. Starting with an empty list.");

* Parses the deadline string into a LocalDate object.
* @param deadlineStr The deadline date as a string in yyyy-MM-dd format.
* @return A LocalDate object representing the deadline, or null if the format is invalid.

* Converts the deadline task into a file-friendly string format.

* Returns the formatted description of the deadline task.
* @return A string representation of the task with its deadline.
* Represents an event task with a start and end date.
* The event has a description and occurs within a specific time range.

* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start date of the event in yyyy-MM-dd format.
* @param to The end date of the event in yyyy-MM-dd format.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the start date is later than the end date.
public Events(String description, String from, String to) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Event 'from' date cannot be later than 'to' date.");
* Parses a date string into a LocalDate object.

// Assuming the format provided is yyyy-MM-dd (e.g., 2019-12-02)

* Returns the formatted description of the event.
* @return A string representation of the event with its description, start, and end dates.
* Returns the string representation of the event in a format suitable for file storage.
* @return A formatted string representing the event for saving to a file.
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* By default, the task is not marked as done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* "X" indicates the task is done, and " " (space) indicates it is not done.
* @return A string representing the status of the task.
* Marks the task as not completed.
* Returns the formatted description of the task, including its status icon.
* @return A string representation of the task with its completion status.
* Returns the string representation of the task formatted for file storage.
* @return A formatted string representing the task for saving to a file.
* Manages a list of tasks and provides operations to add, mark, unmark, delete, and list tasks.
* Constructs a TaskList with the given list of tasks and user interface.
* @param ui    The user interface for displaying messages.
* Searches for tasks that contain the specified keyword in their description.
* The method checks if the message contains a valid keyword (i.e., after the "find" command)
* and searches the task descriptions for any match. If matching tasks are found, they are displayed to the user.
* If no tasks match the keyword, an appropriate message is shown.
* @param message the user's input, expected to be in the format "find <keyword>"
* @throws MinnimMissingTaskDetailException if no keyword is provided (i.e., only "find" is entered)
public void find(String message) throws MinnimMissingTaskDetailException {
// case where only "find" was entered without keyword
String keyword = message.substring(5).trim();  // Extract the keyword from the message
ui.showMessage("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
